clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Bedaquiline is indicated as part of combination therapy in adults 18 years with pulmonary multi drug resistant tuberculosis MDR TB

contraindications.disease: The most common adverse reactions reported in 10 of patients treated with bedaquiline are nausea arthralgia and headache
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Bedaquiline is primarily subjected to oxidative metabolism leading to the formation of N monodesmethyl metabolite M2 M2 is not thought to contribute significantly to clinical efficacy given its lower average exposure 23 to 31 in humans and lower antimycobacterial activity 4 to 6 fold lower compared to the parent compound M2 concentrations appeared to correlate with QT prolongation Bedaquiline inhibits mycobacterial TB at a minimal inhibitory concentration MIC from 0 002 0 06 μg ml and with a MIC50 of 0 03 μg ml Furthermore bacteria that have smaller ATP stores usually in dormant nonreplicating bacilli are more susceptible to bedaquiline

incompatibilities.description: Ivabradine may increase the QTc prolonging activities of Bedaquiline
